div.p: This is to clarify the meal drop-off schedule and locations. Buses will be departing from the schools each morning at 11am. Each bus will follow their afternoon bus schedule, so you will have to estimate the time of arrival at your bus stop. (example: if they usually arrive at 3:20pm, then you should see the bus delivering meals at your approved stop at 11:20am). Someone will need to meet the bus to pick up the meals. If your child does not usually ride the bus, you can meet a bus at any of the approved bus stops to obtain your meals.
The bus schedules can be found on our website at the link below: (you may need to copy and paste this link into your web browser)

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: After a conference call with the Department of Education at noon today, the Mascoma Schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16, 2020. I apologize for the late notification, but this situation is rapidly changing which has caused us to close sooner than planned.
Teachers will report to work on Monday and Tuesday to finalize instructional plans and remote learning will begin on Wednesday, March 18th.
Please continue to check your email as more detailed information will be sent out via that platform.
Thank you for your understanding and flexibility in this situation.

span.span: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a virus (more specifically, a coronavirus) identified as the cause of an outbreak of respiratory illness first detected in Wuhan, China.

div.small: External links are being provided as a convenience and for informational purposes only; they do not constitute an endorsement or an approval by the Mascoma Valley Regional School District (MVRSD) of any of the products, services or opinions of the corporation or organization or individual. MVRSD bears no responsibility for the accuracy, legality or content of the external site or for that of subsequent links. Contact the external site for answers to questions regarding its content.

div.small: Mascoma Valley Regional School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, disability, age, religion, or veteran/military status in its programs and activities.
